h3. Problem Definition
On a JIRA screen with tabs, switching to a Custom screen removes the tabs. 

h3. Steps to reproduce : 
# Create a JIRA screen with tabs
# Open the screen 
# The tabs are showing up on the screen.
# Now click on the "Configure Fields" button and select the 'Custom' link 
# As soon as the custom link is selected, the tabs will disappear.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to see tabs when using a Custom configuration for fields (e.g. either making them visible by default or providing a checkbox to make tabs visible).

h3. Workaround 
It is possible to configure field visibility for selected users using third party plugins such as the Behaviours functionality from [ScriptRunner for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner]. However, this requires the intervention of a JIRA admin.
fields.summary: As a User, I'd like to see tabs when using a Custom configuration for fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the user disable the new project navigation under their profile in JIRA 6.4.12, after upgrade to JIRA 7, the administration for that particular project is missing/disabled.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.12
* JIRA Agile 6.7.11
* JIRA 7.0.0 (JIRA for Software)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In JIRA 6.4.12, install JIRA Agile 6.7.11
# Create a test scrum project with a sample scrum board
# Login as a test user, verify the can browse this project and have the administration access
# Under this user profile, enable the new project navigation then disable it
# Create a copy of the XML backup
# Upgrade to JIRA 7 using this copy of XML backup created in JIRA 6.4.12

h3. Expected Results
The user will still be able to have the administration access of this particular project

h3. Actual Results
The user will no longer able to browse the administration access of this particular project as the new project navigation is missing

h3.Workaround
# Shutdown JIRA
# Run the following SQL to verify the user who is impacted is due to this issue. {code}select * FROM feature WHERE feature_name = 'com.atlassian.jira.projects.ProjectCentricNavigation.Disabled';{code}
# Run the following SQL query in the JIRA database which will delete all the user which disable the new project navigation in JIRA 6.4.12:
{code}
DELETE FROM feature WHERE feature_name = 'com.atlassian.jira.projects.ProjectCentricNavigation.Disabled';
{code}
# Restart JIRA
fields.summary: Project Administration disabled after upgrading to JIRA 7

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
	As an admin I would like our users could reset the Filter Results gadget to its default filter ordering when the page is reloaded. Once we create this gadget and a user clicks to any column to sort, the default sort definded in the filter is gone and never comes back (since the user last columns sorting is saved).

h3. Suggested Solution
	Options to solve this problem:
	* A refresh of the gadgets page could reset the results in this gadget
	* A reset filter order option could be added to the gadget
	* The filter could have an option to block columns sorting
 
h3. Workaround
	The main field (used as the first field in the order by statement) used to order the filter results should always be presented as a column in the gadget. Once the user sorts the column with the correct field, the results will be sorted as defined in the filter.
fields.summary: Reset Filter Results gadget so it shows the results as ordered in the configured filter

*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46035].
{panel}
h2. Summary

The attachment button is not available when commenting in the same transition where attachment is uploaded to the issue. The same happens when user is editing an existing comment.
h2. Scenario 1, issue transition
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a screen to have attachment field and comment field
 # Associate the screen with a workflow
 # Transition the issue to the point where it will use the screen
 # Add an attachment and upon commenting the attachment button is not available to be selected

h3. Expected Results

The attachment button is available and can be selected
h3. Actual Results

No attachment button is available
h2. Scenario 2, editing a comment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a comment to an issue
 # Edit the comment and click on the add attachment option

h3. Expected Results

Browse attachment is displayed

!add-comment-attachment-browse.png|width=433,height=154!
h3. Actual Results

Browse attachment is not displayed
 !Assign-or-Edit-comment-browse-icon-missing.png|width=416,height=213!
h3. Notes

The attachment button in comments will be available if there are existing attachments in the issue before the transition.
h3. Workaround
 # Add attachment first, then in another screen add comment with embedded attachment.
 # Drag and drop attachments to the comment field (the attachment will be uploaded and embedded into the comment)
 # The Attachment button will only appear on a Transition screen when there are existing attachments in the ticket, however, there's no option to browse and upload the attachment by clicking on the "+ Browse" link from the drop-down of the Attachment button. Hence, the workaround is to add the system Attachments field to the transition screen.
fields.summary: Attachment button to embed attachment not available when commenting during issue transition or comment edit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46034].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
If a user uses unsupported environment and installs (or upgrades) JIRA on the server, the installation/upgrade finishes normally.

Currently, users need to refer to the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/supported-platforms-207488170.html] to determine is the environment is compatible. While some admins do this, some others might miss it and then only notice it when they run into issues.


h3. Suggested Solution
If unsupported environment (example database) is being used, then JIRA installer should stop as soon as it detects that giving a clear message to the user something like :
"You are using an unsupported database. Please change to a [supported|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/supported-platforms-207488170.html] database to proceed the installation."
fields.summary: JIRA automatic installer should throw error if an unsupported environment is being used

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46033].
  {panel}

Today every tiny change a user does to a ticket emits an email notification. Only if you use the "edit" window you can reduce the flood. This is not good for anybody.

Suggestion:
1. Provide an option for "digest emails" which is ON by default, as opposed to direct.
2. Provide a few values for the delay: 1 and 10 minutes, and 1, 3, 6 and 12 hours.

The digest should be the "diff" between time 0 and 0+delay. Meaning: I change a bug assignee from Joe to myself, set it to In-Progress, and set back Joe as assignee ... the diff is from previous state to In-progress. It is not interesting to see the 3-step dance to be able to do that state change.

The digest should be per bug, not containing several bugs. If that is interesting it is another enhancement request, outside of the scope for this one.

The digest should probably not cover more than one user. Hence I guess the longer delays could be ignore and you only go for 1 and 10 minutes. Or even just 5 minutes.

The overall idea is to minimize the email flood for when updating one small things which must be done in several steps (such as when a non-assignee want to set a bug in-progress), or when updating a few small things, such as state, assignee, add-CC and maybe a comment, whereof all are logically just one batch.

Thanks in advance
Simon
fields.summary: Add options for digest email notifications to Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On startup, JIRA attempts to perform a collation check. In certain scenarios this check will fail as the database name is incorrectly parsed from the JDBC URL. It can present with different errors depending upon the DBMS used.

h3. Environment

Reproduced with PostgreSQL 9.1 using the below JDBC URL:

{code}
jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/jira700?ssl=true
{code}

The below JDBC URL was reported as problematic however not reproduced:

{code}
jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://example.com:1433;databaseName=Jira
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup PostgreSQL to serve with SSL.
#* Generate certificates.
#* Edit {{postgresql.conf}} to use SSL, and optionally set the certificate location or put them in the {{<pg_install>/data}} directory.
#* Restart PostgreSQL.
#* Add {{?ssl=true}} to the JDBC url.
# Start JIRA.

h3. Expected Results

It is able to correctly read the collation.

h3. Actual Results

The error below will appear:

{noformat}
    ****************************************************************************************************
    The database collation could not be read. An unsupported collation could cause some functionality to not work
    ****************************************************************************************************
{noformat}

And will have a corresponding exception depending upon the DBMS used. JIRA will still start up.

{noformat:title=PostgreSQL}
2015-10-21 22:06:10,507 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [c.a.j.appconsistency.db.CollationCheck] Exception when reading database collation
org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ResultSet not positioned properly, perhaps you need to call next.

	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.DelegatingResultSet.getString(DelegatingResultSet.java:213)
	at com.atlassian.jira.database.DatabaseCollationReader.findCollation(DatabaseCollationReader.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.db.CollationCheck.isOk(CollationCheck.java:60)

	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DatabaseChecklistLauncher.start(DatabaseChecklistLauncher.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.lambda$postDbLaunch$174(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:123)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher$$Lambda$9/1032956955.run(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.doNowOrEnqueue(DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.java:356)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.doNowOrWhenDatabaseConfigured(DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.java:232)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.postDbLaunch(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:122)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.lambda$start$173(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:92)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher$$Lambda$1/853477245.run(Unknown Source)

Or:

{noformat:title=MS SQL Server}
2015-10-23 13:36:17,610 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [jira.appconsistency.db.CollationCheck] Exception when reading database collation
java.sql.SQLException: No current row in the ResultSet.
        at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsResultSet.getColumn(JtdsResultSet.java:285)
        at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsResultSet.getString(JtdsResultSet.java:952)

        at org.apache.catalina.util.LifecycleBase.start(LifecycleBase.java:150)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.addChildInternal(ContainerBase.java:901)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.addChild(ContainerBase.java:877)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHost.addChild(StandardHost.java:652)
        at org.apache.catalina.startup.HostConfig.deployDescriptor(HostConfig.java:677)
        at org.apache.catalina.startup.HostConfig$DeployDescriptor.run(HostConfig.java:1912)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)

        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
There are reported cases where the {{ssl=true}} added in a separate connection-properties parameter instead of the jdbc-url works. 
{code}
<url>jdbc:postgresql://xxxxxxx:5432/db</url>
<connection-properties>ssl=true</connection-properties>
{code}
(!) Proceed at your own risk

h3. Notes
This exception will not prevent JIRA from starting up, and only occurs if the JDBC URL has additional data appended after it.
fields.summary: JIRA is unable to check collation on certain JDBC URLs

fields.description:
The "Projects" dashboard gadget, when viewed in "Detailed" mode, displays a little bar graph of Open Issues (by priority) for each project.

If I add a new issue type to the project, and hide the Priority field for that issue type, then the Open Issues (by priority) bar will not appear.

I looked at the code behind the Projects dashboard gadget, and discovered an error in the rendering logic: it only shows the Open Issues bar if *all* of the field configurations for the project have the Priority field set to visible. If any field configuration has hidden the Priority field, then the Open Issue bar does not appear. That logic should be changed so that the Open Issues bar appears whenever *at least one* field configuration has Priority set to visible.
fields.summary: "Projects" dashboard gadget rendering fault

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46016].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, only the following condition will prevent user from getting deleted:
# reported or been assigned to any issues
# commented on any issues

Which means when the user does not fulfil any of the above condition however he/she added some worklog entry in a particular issue, the user will still be deleted when perform the user deletion action.

Example, when you remove the user in LDAP side, then resyn back to JIRA, user will be deleted instead of being shown as inactive.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if these users will be shown inactive instead of deletion as due to certain preservation of that particular user effort in the issue he/she work on before.
fields.summary: restrict user deletion when user has worklog entry in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46014].
{panel}
h3. Summary

When editing comments, user is not able to browse for attachments but only able select the attachments which are already available in the issue unlike add comments.


h3.Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a comment to an issue
 # Edit the comment and click on the add attachment option

h3. Expected Results

Browse attachment is displayed

 !add-comment-attachment-browse.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

 Browse attachment is not displayed
 !Assign-or-Edit-comment-browse-icon-missing.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Add attachment prior to editing comment. The attachment option will display the attachments which are already attached to the issue.

h3. Notes

This problem happen when "Add flag and comment" via Agile board. There is a bug ticket when "Add flag and comment", see [Attachment icon function is broken|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-15930]
fields.summary: Edit Comment does not show the Browse option in the Attachment Option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46013].
  {panel}

Please allow JIRA administrators to see private filters and dashboards in the GUI.
Some use cases: 
* A user created a filter, forgot to share it, sent the link by mail to some people who should use it, and ran off for holiday. Sure, the people who got the mails will complain. The adminstrator should be able to acces the filter in the GUI and to share it.
* People who leave the company do not delete their private filters and dashboards before they go. Over time, this relicts will pile up. Adminstrators should have the option to clear private filters and dashboards after a user has left.

It's not feasible to query the database to find out which private filters exist and who the owners are, and alter the database. 

First, functionalities in the GUI would be more convenient to use.
Second, you cannot assume that JIRA administrators have access to the database. In our company, I have to contact central administration and ask them if they could run queries and clean up which would be completely unnecessary if I had some more options in the GUI.

Regards, Evelin
fields.summary: JIRA administrators should be able to see private filters and dashboards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46007].
  {panel}

This has been floating around for many years by the look of it but I can't find an open version of it, so here I go!

Use case:

Our team is (attempting to be) Agile and hence we allow all team members to create issues and assign to whomever they think is appropriate (team members are supposed to be trusted and processes should allow quick reaction to change rather than hierarchies of assignment). Also, inspection of our database reveals that the assignee and reporter are the same for 84% of our issues, i.e. 84% of the time it is better to automatically assign to the reporter than require them to manually assign to themselves. Clearly, the process that will best suit us is to have the reporter as the default assignee and allow users to assign to someone else if need be (which will be the minority of the time).

Current workarounds:

1) There is an "assign to me" button which is obviously pretty quick to press. However, the fact that the apparent solution also seems very straightforward means that this is something people find very frustrating. Additionally, it is open to people forgetting (we trust our team members but also accept that they make mistakes).

2) A post function can be added to always assign to the current user. This is not great because it bulldozes over any actual selection the user makes (which will be very irritating 16% of the time for us) and is also not very visible/intuitive even when you do want it to happen (you have to leave the assignee field blank knowing that it is about to be assigned).

Proposal:

Add the option to make the reporter/current user the default assignee in a project.

Justification:

This is a completely null change to anyone not making use of it, the only people who would even notice it would be project admins/leads, who would only be exposed to an extra option in a drop down if they decided to configure the default assignee (which they would probably only be doing if they want this feature!). Whereas people like myself will benefit 84% of the time that we are creating a JIRA issue.
fields.summary: Add "Reporter" or "Current User" option to default assignee choices

fields.description:
Jira doesn't seem to clean the temp directory. I have hundreds of files in jira/temp, named attachment-8344575760376439812.tmp etc. Looking at the file dates, many of the files are several months old. This is very major for our installation we keep running out of space.
h3. Workaround
 * It is safe to manually delete the contents of the JIRA INSTALL/temp directory, *as long as Jira is not running.* Jira uses this directory to store all sorts of temporary files (downloading add-ons, add-ons manually uploaded by users, CSV imports, etc), so deleting it while Jira is running could cause instability, data loss and system crash.
fields.summary: Jira doesn't clean up $JIRA_INSTALL/temp

Steps to reproduce:

1. Try to create a new bug using Quick Create dialog.
2. Fill out required fields and a reference field (which is a custom field)
3. Change issue type and project type.
4. The new form brings Summary with the previous value, however reference field (custom field) is lost.

Expected outcome:
Custom field should not be lost

quote from @hendri.appelmelk [Markit] Hendri who seems to have found the same bug (source: JRA-40622):

"_Can this be related to moving issues to other projects as well?

Example:
Project A and B have a customfield C, within the same context.

Now we move an issue from Project A, issuetype X to Project B, issuetype Z. I would expect the value to be retained, but this is not always true.

Is that in the scope of this bug report?_"
fields.summary: Custom field values are lost when issue type and project is changed

{panel:title=Update as of 2018, July 25th|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#68cff2|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

This is an update to inform you that this ticket is invalid and superseded by JRASERVER-67652.

The key used here, {{jira.permission.create.clone}}, is invalid, and JIRA is just throwing a valid error:
{code}
Unknown type 'clone' in meta attribute 'jira.permission.create.clone'. Valid permission types are defined in permission-types.xml
{code}

JRASERVER-67652 is about a similar, valid bug when using the right key, and there is a Workaround. Please watch it for more details.
{panel}

{panel:title=Original Description}
h3. Summary
After adding the {{jira.permission.create.clone}} workflow property to a Status in JIRA, it's no longer possible to create issues in the related project via REST API. 

h3. Environment
* Using POSTMAN to test

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add the following to the status just after the issue is created (eg. if a newly created issue goes to To Do status, add this property in To Do)

Issue is created fine

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45993].
  {panel}

h4. +Scenario+
In JIRA 6.4, attached images are displayed as thumbnails, while non-thumbnailable files are displayed in a list:
!jira645.png|thumbnail!

In JIRA 7, all files are either displayed as thumbnails or in a list, making it hard to differentiate among the file types:
!jira700.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Suggestion+
Attachment section in JIRA 7 should maintain the old layout as in JIRA 6.4

h4. +Notes+
# There's no new settings from JIRA Administration -> System -> Attachments to take control of the layout
# There's no difference in the *fileattachment* table in the database, in which a .pdf file is still non-thumbnailable and only images are thumbnailable
fields.summary: Attachment section in JIRA 7 does not separate thumbnailable from non-thumbnailable files

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45990].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a webhook to fire on all JIRA config changes, e.g. voting, watching, etc.  
2. Go into JIRA admin and change the voting from enabled to disabled or vice versa
3. Check the event fired by the webhook (I was using RequestBin). The webhookEvent property is set to 'option_watching_changed'. 

Expected results:
I would have thought that the webhookEvent should be set to 'option_voting_changed' or similar.
fields.summary: Voting enable/disable appears to fire the wrong webhook event

fields.description:
There is {{RemoteIssueLinkCreateEvent}}, but it doesn't have any information from which one can detect the issue for which the link was created. Specifically, there's {{RemoteIssueLinkCreateEvent.getRemoteIssueLinkId()}} which should return ID of the remote link that has been created. However, this method always returns {{null}}.

Looking at the code, it's not surprising ({{DefaultRemoteIssueLinkManager.createRemoteIssueLink()}}:

{code}
RemoteIssueLink created = remoteIssueLinkStore.createRemoteIssueLink(remoteIssueLink);
...
eventPublisher.publish(new RemoteIssueLinkCreateEvent(remoteIssueLink))
{code}

The bug is in the second line: it's the original {{RemoteIssueLink}} object without ID that is passed to the event constructor ({{remoteIssueLink}}), not the one that was created and has the ID ({{created}}).

----

Another story for {{RemoteIssueLinkDeletedEvent}}. Here, the {{getRemoteIssueLinkId()}} returns non-null ID of the deleted link. However, one cannot detect the issue from which the link was removed, because the link object no longer exists at this point!

I'd suggest {{AbstractRemoteIssueLinkEvent}} objects to carry the whole {{RemoteIssueLink}} on board, or at least the issue ID. That would eliminate the described problems.
fields.summary: There is no way to detect when remote issue link is created or deleted for a specific issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The browser's "back" button doesn't work as expected when navigating to a project from the *Projects* page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open [jira.atlassian.com|https://jira.atlassian.com];
# Navigate to *Projects » View All Projects*.
# Open the 'atlassian-http' project and wait for the page to load.
# Click the back button on the browser.

h3. Expected Results
The *View All Projects* page would be displayed again.

h3. Actual Results
The page apparently simply refreshes.
 
h3. Notes
* This happens because when the user selects the project, it is redirected to:
{noformat}
https://jira.atlassian.com/projects/HTTP/issues
{noformat}
Which automatically redirects the user to:
{noformat}
https://jira.atlassian.com/projects/HTTP/issues/?filter=allopenissues
{noformat}
So when the user clicks on the 'back' button, it is directed back to:
{noformat}
https://jira.atlassian.com/projects/HTTP/issues
{noformat}
which automatically redirects the user again to:
{noformat}
https://jira.atlassian.com/projects/HTTP/issues/?filter=allopenissues
{noformat}
And so on.

h3.Workaround
* Quickly click the back button on the browser twice.
* Click and hold the back button on the browser and select the "Browse Projects" page in the tab history.
fields.summary: Clicking the back button in the browser doesn't navigate to the previous page when viewing a project

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45986].
  {panel}

When doing a Bulk change the actual limit is set by the *Page Size* value in the user Profile rather than by the values in _jira-config.properties_.

Please find attached some screenshots showing the behaviour.

These are our settings in _jira-config.properties_:
{code}
jira.bulk.edit.limit.issue.count = -1
jira.search.views.default.max = 3000
jira.search.views.max.limit = 3000
jira.search.views.max.unlimited.group = jira.power-searchers
{code}

As a result of this behaviour many users get confused as they see the message to bulk change all the issues but afterwards they're only able to apply the changes to a few of them.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Bulk edit limited by page size

  {panel}

h3. Summary
If permissions in the JIRA home / data directory isn't correct (i.e. belongs to root:root instead of js-jira:js-apps, in the case of Cloud), then the user won't be able to toggle Attachments on. Non system admins may not even see the Edit button, as you can see in this screenshot:

!Screen Shot 2015-10-28 at 16.28.02.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.0.0-OD-08-002

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to Attachment settings at {{domain.atlassian.net//secure/admin/ViewAttachmentSettings.jspa}}, and click *Edit Settings* and toggle off all attachment settings.
# In the filesystem, break the permissions by recursively chowning the {{attachments/}} folder to root:root, for example. (Whatever would not give JIRA access to the files)

{noformat}drwxr-xr-x  4 js-jira js-apps 4096 Jul 29 19:18 .
drwxr-xr-x 11 js-jira js-apps 4096 Oct 26 06:44 ..
drwxr-xr-x  4 root    root    4096 Oct  2 19:58 attachments
drwxr-xr-x  2 js-jira js-apps 4096 Oct 22 14:54 avatars{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
# In a proper save, the screen closes itself, and the changes are applied.
# There should be some error saying the permissions are not correct, at least. Rather than not save.

h3. Actual Results
# Attempt to *Edit Settings* in the attachment settings again, this time enabling attachments. When you click *Update*, it will start to save, but return back to the same screen.
# No errors in the JIRA log.

h3. Workaround
Correct the permissions in both attachments and avatars folders recursively, so JIRA will have access to the files.

*Cloud customers* please contact support to have this done.
fields.summary: As an administrator, user is unable to enable attachments due to file permissions

h3. Problem Definition
When an administrator logs in as a different user, it gets a pop up window noticing that he's logged in as a different user. However, if the administrator has more tabs open (where he was logged with his admin account) and try to continue working as normal, he will get an error message instead of the pop-up window saying he's logged as a different user. The error says _"An unknown error has occurred trying to contact our servers, please try again. If the issue persists please raise a ticket with support."_

h3. Suggested Solution
Instead of the error message, it would be nice to have some kind of warning message stating that you are logged in as another user and cannot perform your usual tasks, because you no longer have the same access.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
*  The "Issues: 30 Day Summary" graph from the project administration page increases when transitioning issues from Resolved to Closed although they are supposed to be in the same category. 
* This issue is related to the closed suggestion - https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-29899

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.12 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# I selected issues using the filter: 
{code}
project = 'XXX' and status = 'Resolved' and resolution is not empty
{code}
# bulk *transitioned* these with the "Close" transition while setting 
{code}
resolution = 'Closed by Multiclose'
{code}
('Closed by Multiclose' is a resolution that is never set for the issues in "Resolved" state. The customer uses this resolution only to indicate that he closed issues using a bulk transition)

h3. Expected Results
* The "Issues: 30 Day Summary" graph from the project administration page should not increase

h3. Actual Results
* The summary increased by the same number of issues that i bulk transitioned.
 
h3. Notes
* If i do the same transition using a single issue matching the filter above this also counts +1 to the resolved issues.
* Only if i *do not* change the resolution on transition close the issue is not counted again as resolved.

The behavior is:
- When resolution is changed the resolved issue counter is increased.
- When resolution is not changed the resolved issue counter is not increased
fields.summary: Bulk transitioning the resolution to close affects the "Issues: 30 Day Summary"

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45963].
  {panel}

*Feature Summary*
As a user or JIRA Admin, there are scenarios where one user in particular is not interested in getting notified from JIRA on issue changes.

In such scenarios, JIRA requires that users be removed from groups that relate to the notification they do not have.

*Expected Result*
Customer would like to be able to tick an option in user management or configure from user profile to opt out of all notifications.

*Actual Result*
The Admin would need to remove the user from all groups and users associated with receiving various notifications.
- This is made more difficult if you try to remove users for a notification associated with group {{reporter}} or something similar.

*Workaround*
- Change the user's email address to a non valid email address.
(!) This however would prevent the user from getting all notifications and also prevent them from getting notification should they forget their password.
fields.summary: Ability to Disable Notification by Users

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, _Request Type_ is not available in axis options in _Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics_ gadget. As a user, it would be great to have it in this gadget.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add _Request Type_ in Axis options (X/Y) in _Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics_ gadget
fields.summary: Add Request Type in axis options in Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45937].
  {panel}

Right now, let's look at a scenario

JIRA Instance A
JIRA Core project: Core_project
User: Peter
Peter has the role 'User' in the Core_project

in the same instance, there is a 
JIRA Service Desk Project JSD_Project

User Peter has the customer role in that project.

Peter is assigned a task in Core_project and realizes he needs to get a user for the system first which he can request in the JSD_Project's customer portal. So he creates the service request and goes back to the Core_project and links the issue as 'is blocked by' to the JSD_project's issue key of his service request.

Now he can create the link - but then he doesn't see it because his user would need the 'browse project' permission of the JSD_Project.

Suggestion: Also, enable viewing of issue links to JSD tickets if they are visible to the user in the customer portal.
fields.summary: Enable JIRA users to see issue links to a JIRA Service Desk ticket in which they are only a customer, yet a reporter of the support request
Add builds, source and review links to project centric navigation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45935].
  {panel}

I don't see any strong reason why we make filters PRIVATE by default.
You create a filter most of the times to share the link with others.

And you don't want to keep it yourself.

I know there are cases where you create filters just to be viewed by you but a good 80-90% of the cases you create the filters to share with the team or to send a report.
fields.summary: Jira Filters are Private by default.  to be made Public.
custom project type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45930].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When moving tasks from one column to another, the page will scroll to where the task was moved thus the user will need to scroll back to the top of the page to move other issues.
Repeatedly needing to scroll up is irritating the user.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a configuration where the user can choose the behaviour of moving issue/task in the sprint
fields.summary: Configure scrolling behaviour when moving tasks in sprints
